info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:48PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Todd and southwestern Tripp Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1047 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Littleburg, or 17 miles north of Valentine, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hidden Timber around 1100 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
